value:
The Heroes here are strong. Being
around them makes me feel...$k$pHuh. Doesn't matter. I just need to
get stronger.

I'm part of a group known as the
Greil Mercenaries back in my world.
Though I'm its leader...$k$pI wouldn't exactly say that I've got a
handle on our finances yet.

You worn out? Let me know if you
are. I'll help, unless you think I'll
just get in your way.

I train when I can, though usually by
myself. I'm not all that great when
it comes to...you know, talk.

I'd spar with my father a lot during
practice when I was younger.$k$pI'd lose every time. Get upset.
Then take him on again.

Are you the leader here? In any
case, I've come with greetings
from $Nf.

Feels good to have a surge like
that. Real good!

I must get stronger. I must
avenge my father.

I'll never match his level of
ability at this rate...

You have my gratitude. I swear to
repay this debt.

I'm Ike of the Greil Mercenaries.
You the one hiring me? Fine. I'm
ready to get to work.

Back when my father was teaching
me how to use a sword, I was
barely more than a boy.$k$pEvery training battle was more
frustrating than the last. I...I just
struggled with it constantly.$k$pThen he died.$k$pI had to protect my sister, the
Greil Mercenaries, everyone that
he did...it was all on me.$k$pBut I was told to use what I'd
been given. If I did, then great
things would happen.$k$pThat really stuck with me. Now
here I am, fighting in battles
with real Heroes.$k$pAnd I'm battling enemies that are
sometimes stronger than I am.
Do I really have a place here?$k$pBut you hired me—rolled the dice
that I might help you do great
things here.$k$pSo...right. Let's just cut this short
there. You believed in me, so I'm
glad to give my all for you.
ふんっ！
おおっ！
うああっ！
I can...keep going...
I won't let anyone die!
Run while you can!
I will finish you!
Out of my way!
Over...
Heh
I'm Ike, commander of the Greil Mercenaries.
Whuh?! Not smart to surprise a mercenary. We're quick on the attack.
Sorry if I'm not that great at...this talking stuff. But know you can always count on me.
My father taught me how to handle a sword. It's all I know.
Pretty good food today. Who was on cooking duty?
As a commander, I'm green as they come. But I do my best. Those I fight with...they're family.
You hired me. I said I'd get to work. See? I did. Glad to give you everything I have.
Sure.
OK.
On it.
